commit.title: [toplevel] Deprecate `-batch` and `-compile` flags.
commit.message:
[toplevel] Deprecate `-batch` and `-compile` flags.

This PR deprecates the use of `coqtop` as batch compiler.

There is no point on having two binaries with the same purpose; after
the experiment in #8690 IMHO we have a lot to gain in terms of code
organization by splitting the compiler and the interactive binary.

We adapt the documentation and adapt the test-suite.

Note that we don't make `coqc` yet a true binary, but here we take
care only of user-land.

That will take place in #8690 and hopefully will bring some
interesting code simplifications, including a unified handling of
arguments.

We adapt the documentation and adapt the test-suite.

Note that we don't make `coqc` yet a true binary, but here we take
care only of user-land.

That will take place in #8690 and hopefully will bring some
interesting code simplifications, including a unified handling of
arguments.

commit.title: [toplevel] Deprecate `-batch` and `-compile` flags.
commit.message:
[toplevel] Deprecate `-batch` and `-compile` flags.

This PR deprecates the use of `coqtop` as batch compiler.

There is no point on having two binaries with the same purpose; after
the experiment in #8690 IMHO we have a lot to gain in terms of code
organization by splitting the compiler and the interactive binary.

We adapt the documentation and adapt the test-suite.

Note that we don't make `coqc` yet a true binary, but here we take
care only of user-land.

That will take place in #8690 and hopefully will bring some
interesting code simplifications, including a unified handling of
arguments.
